title: House Financial Services Committee grills the SEC: MarketWatch live blog
text:
The U.S. House Committee on Financial Services hearing at 10 a.m. on Tuesday is titled “Oversight of the Securities and Exchange Commission: Wall Street’s Cop on the Beat.” This one-panel hearing is set to feature testimony and provide an opportunity for members to question all five SEC commissioners: Chairman Jay Clayton and Robert J. Jackson Jr., Hester M. Peirce, Elad L. Roisman and Allison Herren Lee.

The hearing memo promises discussion and questions about private markets vs. public markets, public company disclosures, the state of cryptocurrency regulation, an enforcement update and Regulation Best Interest, the SEC’s best effort at a fiduciary standard.

While we’re waiting to get started, please take a look at some of our recent stories about the SEC:

• SEC never finalized repo disclosure rule that would give investors more info

• Regulator seeks to keep job at PCAOB, but SEC looks for new candidates

Recent enforcement actions: SEC settles charges with PwC LLP and partner for improper conduct and violating auditor independence rules

In ongoing investigations: Disney whistleblower told SEC the company inflated revenue for years
description: Wall Street’s cop on the beat: The House Financial Services Committee conducts an oversight hearing Tuesday of the Securities and Exchange Commission.
